result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. ROMDENNE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $443.00 court costs paid from cash bail.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Paid $400.00 restitution to Lynn Pfister, 615 S. 19th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220 from cash bail.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. ROMDENNE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for records from State of WI DOJ.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 08-05-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 10-02-14 at 8:30 a.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The Court has received a letter from the victim.  The victim is also present today.  The victim would like to have contact with the defendant.
Attorney Vendetti has no objection to this request.  She has had numerous discussions with the victim about this.
The Court modifies the condition of bail to no assaultive contact with L.P., DOB: 07-29-1982.
Amended cash bail bond executed.  Copy delivered to jail.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Letter from the victim.
Letter from JLF to counsel.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing set for 07-02-14 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Initial appearance reset to 06-23-14 at 2:30 p.m.

The Court reviews the Petition for Appointment of Counsel and denies it, finding the defendant not indigent.
Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-16-14 at 2:30 p.m.
The State moves to modify bail to include the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifyig information within 24 hours and that he not possess any firearms and is to contact the Two Rivers Police Department by noon on 06-10-14 to make arrangements for retrieval of his firearms.
Amended cash bail bond executed.
Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 3rd degree sexual assault and criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-09-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with L.P. DOB: 08-07-1982 or her residence.   Bail furished and the defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail
Minutes.
